title: Hunters Hill and Harrock Hill Walk Route

images.title: Gary Rogers / Flooded part of Hunters Hill Quarry
images.caption: Flooded part of Hunters Hill Quarry. View across Hunter's Hill Quarry and the West Lancashire Plain. This quarry was worked for its sandstone for 200 years up to the 1980's but is now a nature reserve with managed walkways and parking overlooking the Lancashire Plain.

images.title: Chris Denny / Harrock Hall
images.caption: Harrock Hall. The house is set in over 400 acres of land and has a long and varied history.

images.title: Colin Park / Footpath west from Harrock Hill
images.caption: Footpath west from Harrock Hill

images.title: Gary Rogers / Ruined Windmill on Harrock Hill
images.caption: Ruined Windmill on Harrock Hill

images.title: Gary Rogers / View from Harrock hill
images.caption: View from Harrock hill. Towards the radio mast and woodland to the south east

images.title: Gary Rogers / View from Hunters Hill
images.caption: View from Hunters Hill. The village in the near distance is Hill Dale near Parbold and the view beyond is north west across the west Lancashire Plain.

images.title: Colin Park / Ruined windmill on Harrock Hill
images.caption: Another view of the ruined windmill

description: This circular walk visits Hunters Hill and Harrock Hill near Parbold in Lancashire. The walk starts from the Hunters Hill quarry car park on Bannister Lane at postcode WN6 9QD for your sat navs. From here you can follow Bannister Lane north to Bannister Farm where you turn east to climb up to Harrock Hill Windmill. It's a lovely spot with peaceful bluebell woods, a photogenic ruined windmill and some fine views to enjoy. The route then heads south past Harrock Hall and Butteries Wood before coming to High Moor. You then follow Stony Lane west before turning north to round Hunters Hill Quarry and return to the car park. To continue your walking in the area you could climb to Parbold Hill or visit the delightful Parbold Fairy Glen .

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and hillside trails make for a fine walk with your dog.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The circular Hunters Hill and Harrock Hill Walk starts nearby. It visits a fine viewpoint at Harrock Hill where there's also an interesting ruined windmill. Just to the east is the watersports centre at Eccleston Delph where there's a lakeside footpath and a nice cafe. For more walking ideas in the area see the Lancashire Walks page.

display_address: Bannister Lane, Wrightington, Bispham Green, West Lancashire, Lancashire, England, L40 3SS, United Kingdom
